page.title: 09BLYTHE BRIDGE LIBRARY
page.content: Blythe Bridge Library first opened in 1964.It has many different functions such as providing information and answers to questions for villagers.It has pets and also a request service which costs 23p.It has a new identification system called Stock Categorisation which uses coloured labels for books and larger categories such as Art and Gardening.There are 13,710 books in stock as well as 470 records and 176 tapes.Most people bring back books on time but 5% do not.On an average day 120 people borrow books.The Librarian buys books from library suppliers once a fortnight,as well as having regular meetings with other librarians.The Women's Royal Voluntary Service delivers books to the house bound.The library covers a wide area of Blythe Bridge,Meir Heath,Caverswall,Ful ford,Draycott and Stallington.
